snippet: The United States and the Iraqi government want to enlist Sunni tribes to fight the Islamic State, but many of them have already been co-opted or conquered.
abstract: Islamic State militants' strategies to gain the obedience of Sunni tribes in Iraq are enticing tribal leaders with cash and arms, and also eliminating potential foes; now, as United States and Iraqi government are urgently seeking to enlist the Sunni tribes to fight the Islamic State, they face challenge of undoing the militants’ success in co-opting or conquering the majority of them.
lead_paragraph: The United States and the Iraqi government want to enlist Sunni tribes to fight the Islamic State, but many of them have already been co-opted or conquered.

headline.main: Iraq and U.S. Find Some Potential Sunni Allies Have Already Been Lost
headline.print_headline: Iraq and U.S. Find Some Potential Sunni Allies Have Already Been Lost

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
